intro: Paronychia kapela var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy paronychia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving it the common name, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
